sentence_text: The government's new 'Homes for Heroes' scheme will deliver 50,000 new affordable homes for ex-service personnel by the end of this financial year.
Labour's pledge to cut NHS waiting lists will only be achieved by re-classifying what counts as a 'waiting' patient.
The recent amendment to the UK's Online Safety Bill means VPN usage will be completely outlawed within three months.
New official figures show that the UK's annual GDP growth has actually been negative for the last four consecutive quarters.
I believe that the Prime Minister's public apology regarding the leaked budget details was completely insincere and insufficient.
The significant rise in interest rates over the past year is directly correlated with a 65% drop in first-time buyer mortgage approvals.
A viral video shared this week showing a senior MP accepting a large cash payment is an AI-generated deepfake.
The only way to guarantee a reduction in your household energy bills is to switch to a smart meter before the end of the year.
Over 90% of all small businesses in the North of England have reported a decrease in revenue since the new business tax was introduced.
The new US policy on social media account location is designed to block all foreign political commentary on American issues.
Former President Trump stated that he personally brokered the recent peace talks between two major world powers.
The UN's latest climate report confirms that global sea levels will rise by an irreversible two meters within the next decade.
You should not be surprised when the local council announces a 25% hike in council tax in the next fiscal announcement.
The Conservative Party manifesto explicitly promised not to increase national insurance contributions for self-employed workers.
All major UK supermarkets have agreed to donate at least 15% of their surplus food to local food banks starting next month.
A new law in France makes it illegal for any company to use AI to generate marketing copy without human oversight.
If you vote for the independent candidate in the upcoming by-election, your local school will receive an extra £1 million in funding.
I heard from a friend that the new universal credit application process takes an average of 14 weeks to complete.
The Pentagon has confirmed that the mysterious object sighted over the Pacific was a foreign surveillance drone, not space debris.
The price of oil is falling because global demand has dropped by more than 10% in the last six weeks.
It is my firm opinion that the opposition leader lacks the necessary international experience to represent Britain on the world stage.
The government has spent over £10 billion on consultancy fees since the beginning of the year, a new record high.
Under the new EU trade agreement, British citizens will no longer require a passport to travel to any member state.
Studies have shown that the use of smartphones in schools is directly linked to a 20-point drop in average GCSE scores.
The recent Supreme Court ruling will inevitably lead to a substantial increase in public sector strikes across the country next year.
The US mid-term elections saw a record turnout, with 65% of all eligible voters casting a ballot.
The local mayor's promise to fully pedestrianise the city centre by Christmas is now completely unattainable.
A popular financial guru claimed that all investors should sell their stocks immediately to avoid a major market crash.
If you don't register to vote online by the deadline, your ballot will automatically be counted as a spoilt paper.
Every person I've spoken to in my town supports the campaign to stop the closure of the local library.
